title: 108_hr3897
content: The "Welfare Extension and Marriage Promotion Act of 2004" extends the Temporary Assistance for Needy Families Block Grant Program through June 30, 2004. The "Welfare Extension and Marriage Promotion Act of 2004" extends activities authorized by part A of title IV of the Social Security Act through June 30, 2004, with necessary appropriations from the Treasury. A conforming amendment changes the deadline from March 31 to June 30. SEC. 3. Extension of the national random sample study of child welfare and child welfare waiver authority through June 30, 2004. Activities authorized by sections 429A and 1130(a) of the Social Security Act shall continue through June 30, 2004, with necessary appropriations. Grants and payments may be made through the third quarter of fiscal year 2004. SEC. 4. Healthy marriage promotion grants; repeal of bonus for reduction of illegitimacy ratio. Section 403(a)(2) of the Social Security Act is amended to provide competitive grants to States, territories, and tribal organizations for developing programs promoting healthy, married, 2-parent families through public advertising campaigns on marriage value and skills. The text chunk discusses various programs aimed at promoting marital stability and health, including education in high schools on the value of marriage, relationship skills, and budgeting, marriage education for pregnant women and expectant fathers, pre-marital education for engaged couples, and marriage enhancement programs for married couples. The text chunk discusses funding for skills training programs, divorce reduction programs, marriage mentoring programs, and programs to reduce disincentives to marriage in aid programs. $50,000,000 is appropriated for grants in fiscal year 2004. The Secretary's fund for research, demonstrations, and technical assistance under the Social Security Act is amended to appropriate $50,000,000 for fiscal year 2004. This funding is for conducting research, supporting demonstration projects, and providing technical assistance to various entities receiving grants under this part.
